channel.title: [Class Suggestion] Knight 2.0
channel.description:
I've updated this in an easier to read format (using the provided template) and fleshed it out more.
**Knight (Unique)** Blue Dragon, Killer
**Goal:** Eliminate all Unseen, Cult, and any Neutral Killers.
**Passive Ability 1: Royal Defender** If two members of the Blue Dragon who have Royal Blood are killed, you will commit suicide. (_If the second death occurs during the day, you will not be able to use your abilities that night and will commit suicide at that night's conclusion_).
**Passive Ability 2: Oath of Loyalty** Immune to conversion as long as all living court members with the Royal Blood passive remain aligned with the Blue Dragon. Once a Royal Blooded member has been converted, immunity is lost.
**Night ability 1: Patrol (3 uses)** Visit someone, guarding them if they appear to be a member of the Blue Dragon, and attacking them if they appear to be Cult, Unseen, or Neutral. Cannot target the King.
**Night ability 2: Command The Troops (2 uses)** If the King uses his Guards! ability, his target will be revealed to you and you will be immune to death.
I think this would make the Knight a lot more fun to play. Obviously the Patrol ability is very powerful, so the Knight becomes a unique class in this case, and it has limited uses. It also fits the persona of a Knight to have his objective somewhat tied to the Royal Blood passive, and gives him a fairly easily exploitable weakness.

item.description:
I know about that. This is why it works as a passive rather than a day ability or something. If that wasn’t true it would make the ability OP for the Knight.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] Knight 2.0
item.dc:creator: Jaliborc
item.description:
Here’s the thing. When you kill an evil in ToS, its one less evil. That is not true in ToL. Half of evils are night immune in the first place. And, if you do find one, they can just make more. If they made more, you only speeded the game by making effectively an extra kill, which is actually good for the evils (less time for invest).

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] Knight 2.0
item.dc:creator: Morphitrix
item.description:
methomps:

Patrol sounds way OP. It is basically both of the king’s night abilities combined into one, made better and smarter, and upgraded with an attack evil/neut feature.

It’s definitely a powerful ability. It would be OP if it had infinite uses for sure. Limiting the number of uses is the easiest way to balance it. Maybe only 2, or up to 4 uses at most would probably be sufficient.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] Knight 2.0
item.dc:creator: methomps
item.description:
Patrol sounds way OP. It is basically both of the king’s night abilities combined into one, made better and smarter, and upgraded with an attack evil/neut feature.

I think knight is mostly fine. It is not a late game class and should not be played as such. I think one change that can address the “unfun to die so early” aspect is to make it so that knights that are rezzed by physicians are more powerful than other DKs. For example, the DK that was a knight might have extra charges of its abilities or maybe can keep CSing until it targets a BD.

Read full topic

item.description:
You completely missed my point!

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] Knight 2.0
item.dc:creator: Morphitrix
item.description:
Moleland:

Don’t be shocked if your knight claim consists of guarding the king for 5 nights if you die

Yeah I don’t guard king night 1 ever, because it’s a terrible play. You don’t know if there is a Possessor, and if there is one and he chooses to possess some random Bd to attack the King on your guard, you’ve lost 2 Bd right off the bat. Let the healers heal King n1 while he does a check.

Ami:

Knight is a thankless class that nobody wants to play, but is totally necessary. Without Knight there is no stopping Unseen to kill a sheriff (Other than alch or phys) and even if they are healed there is no retribution for the assassin other than a wasted night

Knight to me is bad because even if you guard a Sheriff/Paladin who just outed himself to get an evil player executed, you can’t prevent them from being converted with Sacrifice, and you have no idea if they were on the night of your watch, or any night thereafter. If Knight has the Patrol ability I proposed (it would likely have limited uses), you could target the Sheriff that just outed himself the night following his lead to an execution. He gets converted that night, but you guard him because he was Bd when the night began. Then you target him again the next night, and you will then attack him as he is now detected as Unseen.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] Knight 2.0
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Just give the Knight a Retribution esc passive! Either just give him retribution like what the hunter has or:

Passive: Alert - If you are killed at night you will kill your attacker (but still die)

This encourages the knight to be more aggressive in the day and to take more risks that get attention of others.

Note: This passive does not pierce night immunity

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] Knight 2.0
item.dc:creator: Morphitrix
item.description:
This play is exactly my point. I don’t want to have to kill myself just to prove that someone else is not evil. I don’t think Knight is fun because he dies too easily, gets converted too easily, Knight claim is too suspicious, and people just execute them.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] Knight 2.0
item.dc:creator: Unknown
item.description:
If you think that you are getting suspect, then Cold Steel the most likely evil and indicate a CS in your death note. If you erroneously get a BD, then at least you stopped a mislynch. If you caught an Unseen/Cult people will believe your knight claims more.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] Knight 2.0
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
I disagree with your premises. The lack of a role list hurts sure but the conversion system means you are MORE likely to know an evil by yourself. If someone is converted then they might start acting differently, if you are good you can catch this and CS them. Plus the existence of classes like psy mean that you have a shot at getting proper exclusive and reliable info that the rest of the court lacks thus letting you get kills in yourself.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] Knight 2.0
item.dc:creator: Jaliborc
item.description:
While I’m on the fence about this design, the knight sure feels super useless. In games like ToS without conversion and role lists, you can figure out evils yes.

But in ToL, especially in cult games, even late game picking an evil tends to be kind of random. So it’s only good to CS when BD loses unless you get lucky.

Like, physician is basically a better knight, cause he protects without dying and summons an immortal knight.

Read full topic
